summary: This bill, H.R. 2992, addresses vehicle roadside crashes and work zone safety within the framework of existing legislation. It amends Title 23 of the United States Code and the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to include: expanding the scope of highway safety programs to include occupants of disabled vehicles; incorporating roadside and work zone deaths into injury health data; and enhancing public awareness regarding 'Move Over or Slow Down' laws.  The bill also mandates the formation of working groups to analyze data and develop solutions for crashes involving disabled vehicles and in work zones. Finally, it calls for reports on the utilization and effectiveness of work zone safety funds.
